definition: banner/standard/variant of 標誌|标志[biao1 zhi4]

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: The owner of a race horse is always glad to see his colors get to the winning post.
sentences.chinese: 赛马的主人总是高兴看到他的标帜到达终点。

sentences.english: The sign here indicated where I should go.
sentences.chinese: 这个标识表记标帜指出了我该去的地方。

sentences.english: This is the sign of a person who is respected.
sentences.chinese: 那是一小我被敬服的标识表记标帜。

sentences.english: Still, Powell's confidence never flagged , and this week it was brimming.
sentences.chinese: 不过，鲍威尔的信心从来没有标帜，这周是充满。

sentences.english: Display the total mark as an output.
sentences.chinese: 作为显示输出的总标识表记标帜。

sentences.english: Naval officers have stripes on their sleeves as insignia of their rank.
sentences.chinese: 海军军官在他们的袖子上有像他们身分标帜的条纹。

sentences.english: X marks the spot for that clue, so look carefully.
sentences.chinese: “X”标识表记标帜着线索的地点，所以仔细视察。

sentences.english: It lacks the victorious and aggressive notes .
sentences.chinese: 它缺乏那种胜利进取的标帜。

sentences.english: Geordi presses a key, and a logo appears on the computer screen.
sentences.chinese: 鹰眼按了一个键，一个标帜出现在电脑萤幕上。

sentences.english: Want the look of a digital watch with the cachet of a classical timepiece?
sentences.chinese: 想看磕暌剐经典优异标识表记标帜的数字电子手表吗？

definition: to abstain from/to prohibit (certain foods etc)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to be evident at a glance (idiom)
variant of 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4]
